item.title: Israel Says Cease-Fire Is Back on After Gaza Strikes
item.description: Netanyahu ordered strikes after Israel’s military said Hamas killed a soldier on Tuesday and held up returning the bodies of dead hostages.
item.dc:creator: Anat Peled

item.title: Hurricane Melissa Makes Landfall in Cuba
item.description: The hurricane came ashore in the Cuban province of Santiago de Cuba, a day after hitting Jamaica as one of the most powerful Atlantic storms on record.
item.dc:creator: Jennifer Calfas

item.title: Trump Tells Asia Allies: It’s Your Turn to Boost Military Spending
item.description: During a six-day tour of a region facing the threat of Chinese aggression, Trump reiterates a message that was largely heeded by European nations.
item.dc:creator: Lara Seligman

item.title: Netanyahu Orders ‘Forceful’ Strikes on Gaza
item.description: Israel alleged Hamas launched an attack against troops in Israeli-controlled territory in Gaza.
item.dc:creator: Lara Seligman

item.title: Trump Hails Golden Era in Japan Relations
item.description: The president heaped praise on Japan’s first female prime minister as the two leaders pledged to renew their countries’ alliance aboard a U.S. aircraft carrier.
item.dc:creator: Jason Douglas

item.title: Washington’s Oil Dilemma Returns: How to Hurt Moscow Without Raising Gas Prices
item.description: Enforcing tough measures against one of the world’s top oil producers risks triggering a supply shock.
item.dc:creator: Laurence Norman

item.title: After Demolishing U.S.-China Relationship, Trump Is Rebuilding It His Way
item.description: A summit between the president and Chinese leader Xi Jinping marks renewed engagement in a long-term superpower rivalry.
item.dc:creator: Lingling Wei

item.title: Trump, Xi to Discuss Lowering China Tariffs for Fentanyl Crackdown
item.description: If Beijing takes action to cut the export of chemicals that make fentanyl, the U.S. would cut in half the 20% fentanyl-related levies on Chinese goods.
item.dc:creator: Gavin Bade

item.title: Opinion | Will Hamas Sink Trump’s Gaza Deal?
item.description: Restraining Israel has empowered the terrorists and deterred Arab states.
item.dc:creator: The Editorial Board

item.title: Opinion | María Corina Machado’s Plan for Freedom
item.description: The Venezuelan in hiding from the Maduro regime is fighting a battle between ‘Good and Evil.’
item.dc:creator: Tunku Varadarajan

item.title: Nvidia CEO Praises Trump in MAGA-Themed Speech Ahead of Trade Talks
item.description: With access to the Chinese market in jeopardy, Jensen Huang emphasized the company’s support for the administration’s agenda.
item.dc:creator: Amrith Ramkumar

item.title: Opinion | Doug Ford: Why Ontario Ran the Reagan Ad
item.description: It wasn’t a ‘hostile act,’ but rather an encouragement to embrace what has made our nations great.

item.title: A Trip to Gaza’s New ‘Yellow Line’ Shows Israel Is Digging In
item.description: The temporary dividing line between two foes is becoming more permanent, with earthworks and plans for civilian infrastructure.
item.dc:creator: Dov Lieber

item.title: U.S. Strikes Draw Mexico Into Trump’s Campaign Against Drug Boats
item.description: The defense secretary said 14 people were killed and there was one survivor. The U.S. alerted Mexico, whose navy said search-and-rescue efforts were ongoing.
item.dc:creator: Santiago Pérez

item.title: How U.A.E. Arms Bolstered a Sudanese Militia Accused of Genocide
item.description: Reports by U.S. intelligence agencies show an increase in the flow of materiel from the U.A.E. to the rebel Rapid Support Forces since the spring, according to U.S. officials.
item.dc:creator: Robbie Gramer

item.title: Putin Uses Old Missile Technology to Send a New Message to the West
item.description: President Vladimir Putin hailed the first long-distance test of a nuclear-powered cruise missile that he said has no equal in the West.
item.dc:creator: Daniel Michaels

item.title: Trump’s Big Tariff Task in Asia Is to Close the Deal
item.description: The president’s ability to reorder global trade through personal diplomacy will be tested during his tour of Asia this week.
item.dc:creator: Shan Li

item.title: Japan-U.S. Outline Investment Plan; Trump Says Toyota to Invest $10 Billion in U.S. Auto Plants
item.description: President Trump said Japanese auto giant Toyota is poised to invest $10 billion in auto plants in the U.S.
item.dc:creator: Jason Douglas

item.title: China Vows to Significantly Boost Household Consumption Rate
item.description: China’s communist elites have pledged to let consumption play a bigger role in driving growth over the next five years.

item.title: Shinzo Abe’s Killer Says ‘I Did It’ as Trial Begins
item.description: A 45-year-old man admitted to killing the former Japanese prime minister, and his defense team asked the court for leniency at the opening of his trial.
item.dc:creator: Junko Fukutome

item.title: Hurricane Melissa Barrels Down on Jamaica as Category 5 Storm
item.description: Three people have been killed as the island prepares for flash floods and heavy rainfall.
item.dc:creator: Joseph De Avila

item.title: Victims of Palestinian Attacks Say Prisoner Releases Will Lead to More Violence
item.description: Some of those released as part of the Gaza cease-fire were serving long sentences for crimes like murder.
item.dc:creator: Natasha Dangoor

item.title: Argentina’s Slums Abandoned Peronism—and Handed Milei the Win
item.description: The libertarian president’s ruling party staged a stunning comeback in pivotal midterm elections with unexpected support from the working class.
item.dc:creator: Samantha Pearson

item.title: China Pushes to Silence Victims of African Mining Disaster
item.description: Toxic waste from a Chinese mine in Zambia washed through homes and fields. Compensation offers are tied to nondisclosure.
item.dc:creator: Nicholas Bariyo

item.title: Opinion | Xi Gives Trump a Taiwan Test
item.description: China’s president wants the U.S. to oppose the democratic island’s independence.
item.dc:creator: The Editorial Board

item.title: Opinion | Argentina’s Milei Gets a Second Wind
item.description: After his coalition’s election victory, will he try more durable monetary reform?
item.dc:creator: The Editorial Board

item.title: Milei’s Clear-Cut Victory Unlocks a Wall Street Windfall
item.description: The win for Argentine President Javier Milei’s party is rewarding investors who bet on the country.
item.dc:creator: Jack Pitcher

item.title: Opinion | The Mideast Cease-Fire Is Both a Defeat and a Victory for Islamists
item.description: Iran and its allies are on the ropes, but the Sunni alliance led by Turkey and Qatar is ascendant.
item.dc:creator: Jonathan Spyer

item.title: Sudanese Rebels, Accused of Genocide, Seize Key City
item.description: The capture of the El Fasher gives the rebel Rapid Support Forces the last government stronghold in Darfur, where they have twice been accused of committing genocide.
item.dc:creator: Nicholas Bariyo

item.title: Five Takeaways From Milei’s Surprising Victory in Argentina’s Election
item.description: The midterm election outcome is a win for President Trump and free markets, and a big loss for the Peronists and pollsters.
item.dc:creator: Samantha Pearson

item.title: Two U.S. Navy Aircraft From Same Carrier Crash Into South China Sea
item.description: A helicopter and a jet fighter crashed into the South China Sea within 30 minutes of each other.
item.dc:creator: Gabriele Steinhauser

item.title: Milei Wins Mandate for Free-Market Revolution in Argentina’s Election
item.description: President Javier Milei scored a decisive political win Sunday, tightening his grip on Argentina’s Congress.
item.dc:creator: Santiago Pérez

item.title: Japan Woos Trump With a Royal Welcome
item.description: A meeting with the country’s emperor, though short on pomp, aimed to warm up the president at the start of his visit.
item.dc:creator: Junko Fukutome

item.title: Headroom Yet to Be Decided as U.K. Prepares for Key Budget
item.description: The government is expected to raise taxes, but the size of those increases will partly depend on how large a margin for error it wants as it aims to meet its fiscal rules.
item.dc:creator: Paul Hannon

item.title: China Industrial Profits Keep Up Strong Growth
item.description: Industrial profits rose 21.6% from a year earlier in September, following a 20.4% rise in August that ended a three-month run of declines.

item.title: The U.S. Evacuated Them From Afghanistan—Then They Got Stuck in the Desert
item.description: Some 1,300 Afghans are in limbo at an American camp in Qatar, unable to continue to the U.S. but in danger if they go back home.
item.dc:creator: Michelle Hackman

item.title: The Effort to Court Trump Abroad: Deals, Flattery and Jet Fighters
item.description: Lavish welcome ceremonies and nominations for the Nobel Peace Prize are part of foreign leaders’ charm offensives when the American president comes to town.
item.dc:creator: Meridith McGraw

item.title: Trump Reaches Trade Pacts With Southeast Asian Nations
item.description: The U.S. will exempt some products from tariffs in exchange for lower levies and purchases of U.S. goods across Malaysia, Cambodia, Thailand and Vietnam.
item.dc:creator: Gavin Bade

item.title: How Russia’s Sanctioned Arctic Gas Found a Chinese Loophole
item.description: The U.S. and its allies have tried to cripple Russia’s energy industry, but Moscow has found loopholes time and again.
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Feng

item.title: U.S., China Sound Confident Note After Trade Talks
item.description: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent hailed a “very successful framework” for this week’s Trump-Xi meeting, while Beijing said the two sides reached a preliminary consensus on key issues.
item.dc:creator: Chun Han Wong

item.title: Louvre Heist Investigation Yields First Arrests
item.description: Police made the arrests as one of the suspects was preparing to take a flight out of France.
item.dc:creator: Nick Kostov

item.title: Fear Grips a Caribbean Nation in the Shadow of U.S. Boat Strikes
item.description: In Trinidad and Tobago, fishermen are staying home and a family mourns following airstrikes on alleged drug boats.
item.dc:creator: Kejal Vyas

item.title: State Department Intelligence Agency Dissented Over Putin’s Appetite for Peace
item.description: The Central Intelligence Agency had a more positive assessment of the Russian leader’s willingness to talk.
item.dc:creator: Brett Forrest

item.title: With Sarkozy in Prison, France Asks: Has the Judiciary Gone Too Far?
item.description: The country’s fiercely independent court system has delivered rulings against both a former president and a far-right leader this year.
item.dc:creator: Noemie Bisserbe

item.title: Inside the Warehouse in Israel Where the U.S. Is Overseeing Trump’s Peace Plan
item.description: Two hundred U.S. troops working with Israel’s military and others have scrambled to build out a new Civil-Military Coordination Center to monitor the Israel-Hamas cease-fire.
item.dc:creator: Vera Bergengruen

item.title: A Hiking Death Roils a Fashion Empire and the Heirs to a Fortune
item.description: Almost a year after billionaire Isak Andic fell off a cliff in Spain, his demise remains under investigation and hangs over the Mango fast-fashion company.
item.dc:creator: Jenny Strasburg

item.title: It Sits on a Vast Haul of Mineral Wealth. Now This Arctic City Must Be Moved.
item.description: Home to some of the largest finds of iron ore and rare earths, Kiruna, in Sweden, is undergoing an unparalleled relocation project—with the entire city center set to be rebuilt miles away.
item.dc:creator: Sune Engel Rasmussen

item.title: As Putin Digs In, a Long—and Different—War With Ukraine Looms
item.description: Long-range strikes on infrastructure are becoming increasingly critical as front-line advances stall.
item.dc:creator: Yaroslav Trofimov

item.title: Pentagon Orders Aircraft Carrier to the Caribbean
item.description: The move would be a major escalation of the Trump administration’s military campaign to target drug smugglers and threaten governments in Latin America.
item.dc:creator: Lara Seligman

item.title: Russia’s Central Bank Cuts Key Rate as New Sanctions Loom
item.description: The cut comes as an already slowing economy braces for the impact of fresh sanctions in response to President Vladimir Putin’s continued war on Ukraine.
item.dc:creator: Paul Hannon

item.title: Will India and China Be Able to Resist U.S. Sanctions on Russian Oil?
item.description: New Delhi and Beijing have so far resisted U.S. calls to stop buying Russian crude, but far-reaching sanctions will be hard to ignore.
item.dc:creator: Jiahui Huang

item.title: Why Trump Reached a Breaking Point With Putin
item.description: The U.S. president was given three options for sanctions after running out of patience with the Kremlin over its war in Ukraine.
item.dc:creator: Alexander Ward

item.title: U.S. Oil Sanctions Strike at Russia’s Economic Lifeline
item.description: The U.S. has hit Moscow’s biggest oil producers at a vulnerable time for the country’s economy.
item.dc:creator: Laurence Norman

item.title: U.K. Inflation Unexpectedly Holds Steady
item.description: The country’s annual rate of inflation in September was at the same pace seen in August, but was still well above the Bank of England’s target.
item.dc:creator: Ed Frankl

item.title: Corruption Scandals Bring Trouble for Nelson Mandela’s Party
item.description: Critics say African National Congress members enrich themselves and their friends using laws meant to empower South Africa’s Black majority.
item.dc:creator: Alexandra Wexler

item.title: Trump Signals Support for Selling Submarines to Australia
item.description: The president’s comments calmed fears that he would pull out of the Biden-era deal and came as he struck an agreement with the U.S. ally on rare earths.
item.dc:creator: Mike Cherney

item.title: U.K. Government Overshoots Borrowing Target in First Half, Making Tax Rises Likely
item.description: A key goal for the government, according to economists, should be to persuade investors the government has the will and policies to whittle down debt over coming years.
item.dc:creator: Paul Hannon

item.title: How a Right-Wing Hindu Group Went From Fringe to Mainstream in India
item.description: India’s Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh group is stepping out of the shadows and flexing its power.
item.dc:creator: Shan Li

item.title: Prince Andrew Loses ‘Duke of York’ Title After Epstein Scandal
item.description: The prince agrees to forgo use of his royal title after pressure from Buckingham Palace.
item.dc:creator: Max Colchester

item.title: Trump Organization Expands in India, Where Many of Its Partners Face Accusations
item.description: Indian real-estate firms have been accused of fraud, money laundering and more on other projects. The Trumps have stepped up overseas deals in the president’s second term.
item.dc:creator: Peter Grant

item.title: India Delicately Counters Trump Claim It Will Drop Russian Oil
item.description: New Delhi didn’t outright contradict the president, saying it was committed to protecting consumers by diversifying its energy supplies.
item.dc:creator: Shan Li

item.title: International Criminal Court Convicts Sudanese Militia Leader of War Crimes
item.description: The guilty finding is a rare conviction for the court, and comes as the institution confronts U.S. sanctions and sexual-assault allegations.
item.dc:creator: Matthew Dalton

item.title: German Firm’s African Green-Energy Project Runs Into Ghosts From Past
item.description: Namibia’s indigenous Nama population argues they have been sidelined in a $10 billion project being built on their ancestral lands.
item.dc:creator: Caroline Kimeu

item.title: Powerful Earthquake Kills at Least 69 People in Central Philippines
item.description: The Philippines sits in the so-called Ring of Fire, a seismic arc of volcanoes and fault lines around the Pacific basin.
item.dc:creator: Gabriele Steinhauser

item.title: The Path to the American Dream Is Narrowing for Indian Tech Workers
item.description: About 70% of H-1B visas go to Indians. Looming changes to the program are upending plans, but may help India retain talent.
item.dc:creator: Tripti Lahiri

item.title: Pentagon Review of Aukus Security Pact Worries U.K., Australia
item.description: The review throws into doubt a strategic partnership that aims to give Australia nuclear-powered submarines and deter Chinese aggression in the Indo-Pacific.
item.dc:creator: Rhiannon Hoyle

item.title: The Best Travel Shoes to Make Every Trip Lighter and Easier
item.description: No matter the destination, these shoes will get you there.
item.dc:creator: Hannah Selinger

item.title: The Best Laptop Backpacks, According to CEOs, Pilots and Stylists
item.description: From commuting to long-haul flights, these are the bags avid travelers rely on for their trips.
item.dc:creator: Sal Vaglica

item.title: Best of Buy Side Awards 2025: Travel
item.description: Tried and tested by our expert travel writers and editors, these Buy Side best product award-winning luggage picks will ensure your trip gets off to a great start.
item.dc:creator: Nick Guy

item.title: Russia’s Side Quest to Dominate Africa: Hijack a Videogame
item.description: Players in the ‘African Dawn’ videogame are asked to choose a side aligned with either Russia or the West.
item.dc:creator: Sarah E. Needleman

item.title: Families Battle Tech Giants as Australia Pushes for an Under-16 Social-Media Ban
item.description: The proposal marks the latest effort by political leaders worldwide to regulate children’s use of platforms, amid concerns that it is harming their mental health.
item.dc:creator: Mike Cherney

item.title: ‘We’ve Got to Kill’: Inside New Zealand’s Mission to Wipe Out Predators
item.description: Scientists debate whether a multibillion-dollar plan to eliminate invasive animals by 2050 is feasible.
item.dc:creator: Mike Cherney
